skill.name: helm-chart-scaffolding
skill.description: Design, organize, and manage Helm charts for templating and packaging Kubernetes applications with reusable configurations. Use when creating Helm charts, packaging Kubernetes applications, or implementing templated deployments.
skill.summary: Design, organize, and manage Helm charts for templating and packaging Kubernetes applications with r...
skill.author: unknown

security_audit.summary: No data theft or malicious execution patterns detected. The content is documentation and a local validation script that runs Helm commands only.

content.user_title: Build Helm charts with a reliable scaffold
content.value_statement: Creating consistent Helm charts is slow and error prone. This skill gives clear structure, templates, and validation steps for faster, safer delivery.
actual_capabilities: Explain the standard Helm chart directory structure
Provide a values.yaml template with security defaults
Describe templating helpers and common patterns
Outline validation steps and a Helm validation script
limitations: Does not generate files or run commands automatically
Does not access Kubernetes clusters or repositories
Requires Helm to run validation steps
Does not manage CI or chart publishing

use_cases.title: Standardize new charts
use_cases.description: Create consistent Helm charts with shared structure and values across teams.

use_cases.title: Package a new service
use_cases.description: Turn a Kubernetes app into a reusable Helm chart with clear defaults.

use_cases.title: Validate charts before release
use_cases.description: Use the validation steps to catch missing files and template errors.

prompt_templates.title: Start a new chart
prompt_templates.scenario: You need a basic chart structure
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Helm chart scaffold for a web API. Include the standard folders and key files.

prompt_templates.title: Design values.yaml
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft a values.yaml structure for a service with image, ingress, resources, and probes.

prompt_templates.title: Add templating helpers
prompt_templates.scenario: You want reusable labels and names
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide helper templates for fullname, labels, and image tag resolution.

prompt_templates.title: Validate a chart
prompt_templates.prompt: List validation steps and a script outline to lint and dry run a Helm chart.

output_examples.input: Give me a checklist to validate my Helm chart before release
output: Confirm Chart.yaml, values.yaml, and templates folder exist
Run helm lint and fix any warnings
Render templates and review the output
Perform a dry run install with debug enabled
Verify resources, probes, and resource limits are present

best_practices: Keep values.yaml organized by function and environment
Use helper templates to avoid repeated logic
Lint and dry run before packaging

faq.question: Is this compatible with Helm 3 charts
faq.answer: Yes. The guidance targets Helm 3 and Chart.yaml apiVersion v2.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill
faq.answer: It provides guidance and templates only. It does not execute Helm or create files.

faq.question: Can it integrate with my CI pipeline
faq.answer: It can suggest steps, but you must wire them into your CI system.

faq.question: Does it access my cluster or secrets
faq.answer: No. It does not access clusters, files, or external services.

faq.question: What if helm lint fails
faq.answer: Review the lint output, fix template or values issues, then re run the check.

faq.question: How does it compare to helm create
faq.answer: It complements helm create by giving structure, templates, and validation guidance.
